Verily , verily , I say unto you , Except
ye eat the flesh của the Son của man , và drink his blood , ye have no life in you .
Whoso eateth my flesh , và drinketh my blood , hath eternal life ; và I will raise him up
at the last ngày .
For my
flesh is meat indeed , và my blood is drink indeed .
He that eateth my flesh , và drinketh my blood , dwelleth in me , và I in him .
As
the living Father hath sent me , và I live by the Father : so
he that eateth me , even he shall live by me .
This is that bread
which came down from heaven : not as your fathers did eat
manna , và are dead :
he that eateth của this bread shall live for ever .
These things said he in the synagogue , as he taught in Capernaum .
Many therefore của his các môn đệ , when they had heard this , nói , This is an hard saying ; who can hear it ?
When Đức Giê-su knew in himself that his các môn đệ murmured at it , he nói unto them ,
Doth this offend you ?
What và nếu ye shall see con trai của man ascend up where he was
before ?
It is the spirit
that quickeneth ; the flesh profiteth nothing :
the words that I speak unto you , they are spirit , và they are life .
But there are some của you that believe not .
For Đức Giê-su knew from the beginning who they were
that believed not , và who should
betray him .
và he nói ,
Therefore
said I unto you , that no man can come unto me , except
it were given unto him của my Father .
From that time many của his các môn đệ went back
,
và walked no more with him .
Then nói Đức Giê-su
unto mười hai (môn đệ) ,
Will ye
also go away ?
mee untranslated sentence should be: Will ye not also go away? thelete humeis mee kai upagein This is the reason I placed the (empty) tag just after ye (humeis)
Then Simon Phi-e-rơ answered him , Lord , to whom shall we go ? thou hast the words của eternal life .
và we believe và are sure that thou art that Christ , con trai của the
living Chúa .
Đức Giê-su answered them ,
Have not I chosen you
twelve , và một của you is a devil ?
He spake của Judas Iscariot con trai của Simon : for he it was that should betray him , being một của
mười hai (môn đệ) .
de (for) untranslated empty tag placed at the beginning of the verse

CHAPTER 7.
After these things Đức Giê-su walked in Galilee : for he would not walk in Jewry , because
the Dân Do-thái sought to kill him .
Now
the Dân Do-thái' feast của tabernacles was at hand .
His brethren therefore nói unto him , Depart hence , và go into Judæa , that thy các môn đệ also may see the works that thou doest .
For there is no man that doeth any thing in secret , và he himself seeketh to be known
openly . nếu thou do these things , shew thyself to the world .
For neither did his brethren believe in him .
Then Đức Giê-su nói unto them ,
My time is not yet come : but
your
time is alway ready .
The world cannot
hate you ; but me it hateth , because I testify của it , that the works thereof are evil .
Go ye up unto this feast : I go not up yet unto this feast ; for
my time is not yet full come .
When he had nói these words unto them , he abode still in Galilee .
But when his brethren were gone up , then went he also up unto the feast , not openly , but as it were in secret .
Then
the Dân Do-thái sought him at the feast , và nói , Where is he ?
và there was much murmuring among the people concerning him : for some
nói ,
He is a good man : others
nói , Nay ; but he deceiveth the people .
Howbeit no man spake openly của him for fear
của the Dân Do-thái .
Now
about the midst của the feast Đức Giê-su went up into đền thờ , và taught .
và
the Dân Do-thái marvelled , saying , How knoweth this man letters , having never learned ?
Đức Giê-su answered them , và nói ,
My
doctrine is not mine , but
his that sent me .
nếu any man will do his will , he shall know của the doctrine , whether it be của Chúa , or whether I speak của myself .
He that speaketh của himself seeketh
his own glory : but
he that seeketh
his glory that sent him , the same is true , và no unsự công chính is in him .
Did not Môi-se give you the law , và yet none của you keepeth the law ? Why go ye about to kill me ?
The people answered và nói , Thou hast a devil : who goeth about to kill thee ?
Đức Giê-su answered và nói unto them ,
I have done một work , và ye all marvel .
Môi-se therefore
gave unto you circumcision ; ( not because it is của Môi-se , but của the fathers ;) và ye on the sabbath day circumcise a man .
nếu a man on the sabbath day receive circumcision , that the law của Môi-se should not be broken ; are ye angry at me , because I have made a man every whit whole on the sabbath day ?
Judge not according to the appearance , but judge
righteous judgment .
Then nói some của them of Giê-ru-sa-lem , Is not this he , whom they seek to kill ?
But , lo , he speaketh boldly , và they say nothing unto him . Do the rulers know indeed that this is the very Christ ?
Howbeit we know this man whence he is : but when
Christ cometh , no man knoweth whence he is .
Then cried Đức Giê-su in đền thờ as he taught ,
saying ,
Ye both know me , và ye know whence I am : và I am not come của myself , but
he that sent me is true , whom ye know not .
But I know him : for I am from him , và he hath sent me .
Then they sought to take him : but no man laid hands on him , because his hour was not yet come .
và many của the people believed on him , và nói ,
When Christ cometh ,
will he do more miracles than these which this man hath done ?
The Pharisees heard that the people murmured such things concerning him ; và the Pharisees và the chief priests sent officers to take him .
Then nói Đức Giê-su unto them ,
Yet a little while am I with you , và then I go unto
him that sent me .
Ye shall seek me , và shall not find me : và where I am , thither ye cannot
come .
Then nói
the Dân Do-thái among themselves , Whither will he go , that we shall not find him ?
will he go unto the dispersed among the Gentiles , và teach the Gentiles ?
What manner of saying is this that he nói , Ye shall seek me , và shall not find me : và where I am , thither ye cannot
come ?
In the last
ngày , that great ngày của the feast , Đức Giê-su stood và cried , saying ,
nếu any man thirst , let him come unto me , và drink .
He that believeth on me , as the scripture hath nói , out of his belly shall flow rivers của living nước .
( But this spake he của the Spirit , which
they that believe on him should receive : for the Holy Ghost was not yet given ; because that Đức Giê-su was not yet glorified .)
Many của the people therefore , when they heard this saying , nói , của a truth this is the Prophet .
Others nói , This is the Christ . But some nói , Shall
Christ come out of Galilee ?
Hath not the scripture nói , That Christ cometh của the seed của Đa-vít , và out của the town của Bethlehem , where Đa-vít was ?
So there was a division among the people because của him .
và some của them would have taken him ; but no man laid hands on him .
Then came the officers to the chief priests và người Pha-ri-si ; và they nói unto them , Why
have ye not brought him ?
The officers answered , Never man spake
like this man .
Then answered them the Pharisees , Are ye also
deceived ?
Have any của the rulers or của the Pharisees believed on him ?
But this people
who knoweth not the law are cursed .
Nicodemus saith unto them , (
he that came to Đức Giê-su by night , being một của them ,)
Doth our law judge any man ,
before it hear
him , và know what he doeth ?
They answered và nói unto him ,
Art thou also của Galilee ? Search , và look : for out of Galilee ariseth no prophet .
và every man went unto his own house .

CHAPTER 8.
Đức Giê-su went unto the mount của Olives .
và early in the morning he came again into đền thờ , và all the people came unto him ; và he sat down , và taught them .
và những chuyên gia kinh luật và người Pha-ri-si brought unto him a woman taken in adultery ; và when they had set her in the midst ,
They say unto him , Master , this woman was taken trong adultery , trong the very act .
Now Môi-se in the law commanded us , that such should be stoned : but what sayest thou ?
This they nói , tempting him , that they might have to accuse him . But
Đức Giê-su stooped down , và with his finger wrote on the ground ,
as though he heard them not
.
me prospoioumenos omitted in most variants (even in the dutch Staten Vertaling, which uses TR as basis as well)
So when they continued asking him , he lifted up himself , và nói unto them ,
He that is without sin among you , let him first cast a stone at her .
và again he stooped down , và wrote on the ground .
và
they which heard it ,
being convicted by their own conscience , went out một by một , beginning at
the eldest , even unto
the last : và Đức Giê-su was left alone , và the woman standing in the midst .
When Đức Giê-su had lifted up himself , và thấy none but the woman , he nói unto her ,
Woman , where are those thine accusers ? hath no man condemned thee ?
She nói , No man , Lord . và Đức Giê-su nói unto her ,
Neither do I condemn thee : go , và sin no more .
Then spake Đức Giê-su again unto them , saying ,
I am ánh sáng của the world :
he that followeth me shall not
walk in darkness , but shall have ánh sáng của life .
The Pharisees therefore nói unto him , Thou bearest record của thyself ; thy record is not true .
Đức Giê-su answered và nói unto them ,
Though I bear record của myself , yet my record is true : for I know whence I came , và whither I go ; but ye cannot tell whence I come , và whither I go .
Ye judge after the flesh ; I judge no man .
và yet nếu I judge ,
my judgment is true : for I am not alone , but I và
the Father that sent me .
It is also written in
your law , that the testimony của two men is true .
I am
one that bear witness của myself , và
the Father that sent me beareth witness của me .
Then said they unto him , Where is thy Father ? Đức Giê-su answered ,
Ye neither know me , nor my Father : nếu ye had known me , ye should have known
my Father also .
These words spake Đức Giê-su in the treasury , as he taught in đền thờ : và no man laid hands on him ; for his hour was not yet come .
Then nói Đức Giê-su again unto them ,
I go my way , và ye shall seek me , và shall die in your sins : whither I go , ye cannot
come .
Then nói
the Dân Do-thái , Will he kill himself ? because he saith , Whither I go , ye cannot
come .
và he nói unto them ,
Ye are from
beneath ; I am from
above : ye are của this world ; I am not của this world .
I nói therefore unto you , that ye shall die in your sins : for nếu ye believe not that I am he , ye shall die in your sins .
Then said they unto him , Who
art thou ? và Đức Giê-su saith unto them ,
Even the same that
I nói unto you from the beginning .
I have many things to say và to judge của you : but
he that sent me is true ; và I speak to the world those things which I have heard của him .
They understood not that he spake to them của the Father .
Then nói Đức Giê-su unto them ,
When ye have lifted up con trai của man , then shall ye know that I am he , và that I do nothing của myself ; but as my Father hath taught me , I speak these things .
và
he that sent me is with me : the Father hath not left me alone ; for I do always
those things that please him .
As he spake these words , many believed on him .
Then nói Đức Giê-su to
those Dân Do-thái which believed on him ,
nếu ye continue in
my word , then are ye my các môn đệ indeed ;
và ye shall know the truth , và the truth shall make you free .
They answered him , We be Áp-ra-ham's seed , và were never trong bondage to any man : how sayest thou ,
Ye shall be made free ?
Đức Giê-su answered them ,
Verily , verily , I say unto you ,
Whosoever
committeth sin is the servant của sin .
và
the servant abideth not in the house for ever : but con trai abideth
ever .
nếu con trai therefore shall make you free , ye shall be free indeed .
I know that ye are Áp-ra-ham's seed ; but ye seek to kill me , because
my word hath no place in you .
I speak that which I have seen with my Father : và ye do that which ye have seen with your father .
They answered và nói unto him , Áp-ra-ham is our father . Đức Giê-su saith unto them ,
nếu ye were
Áp-ra-ham's children , ye would do
the works
của Áp-ra-ham .
But now ye seek to kill me , a man that hath told you the truth , which I have heard của Chúa : this did not Áp-ra-ham .
Ye do the deeds của your father .
Then said they to him , We be not born của fornication ; we have một Father , even Chúa .
Đức Giê-su nói unto them ,
nếu Chúa were your Father , ye would love
me : for I proceeded forth và came from Chúa ; neither
came I của myself , but he sent me .
Why
do ye not understand
my speech ? even because ye cannot
hear
my word .
Ye are của your father
the devil , và the lusts of your father ye will do . He was a murderer from the beginning , và abode
not in the truth , because there is no truth in him . When he speaketh a lie , he speaketh của
his own : for he is a liar , và the father của it .

và because I tell you the truth , ye believe me not .
Which của you convinceth me của sin ? và nếu I say the truth , why
do ye not believe me ?
He that is của Chúa heareth God's words : ye therefore
hear them not , because ye are not của Chúa .
Then answered
the Dân Do-thái , và nói unto him , Say we not well that thou art a Samaritan , và hast a devil ?
Đức Giê-su answered ,
I have not a devil ; but I honour my Father , và ye do dishonour me .
và I seek not mine own glory : there is
one that seeketh và judgeth .
Verily , verily , I say unto you , nếu a man keep
my saying , he shall never
see death .
eis ton aiona missing in VNI
Then nói
the Dân Do-thái unto him , Now we know that thou hast a devil . Áp-ra-ham is dead , và the các tiên-tri ; và thou sayest , nếu a man keep my saying , he shall never
taste của death .
Art thou greater than our father Áp-ra-ham , which is dead ? và the các tiên-tri are dead : whom makest thou thyself ?
Đức Giê-su answered ,
nếu I honour myself , my honour is nothing : it is my Father
that honoureth me ; của whom ye say , that he is your Chúa :
Yet ye have not known him ; but I know him : và nếu I should say ,
I know him not , I shall be a liar like unto you : but I know him , và keep his saying .
Your father Áp-ra-ham rejoiced to see
my ngày : và he saw it , và was glad .
Then nói
the Dân Do-thái unto him , Thou art not yet năm mươi years old , và hast thou seen Áp-ra-ham ?
Đức Giê-su nói unto them ,
Verily , verily , I say unto you , Before Áp-ra-ham was , I am .
Then took they up stones to cast at him : but Đức Giê-su hid himself , và went out của đền thờ , going through the midst của them , và so passed by .

CHAPTER 9.
và as Đức Giê-su passed by , he saw a man which was blind from his birth .
và his các môn đệ asked him , saying , Master , who did sin , this man , or his parents , that he was born blind ?
Đức Giê-su answered ,
Neither hath this man sinned , nor his parents : but that the works của Đức Chúa Trời should be made manifest in him .
I must work the works
của him that sent me , while it is ngày : the night cometh , when no man can work .
As long as I am in the world , I am ánh sáng của the world .
When he had thus spoken , he spat on the ground , và made clay của the spittle , và he anointed
the eyes
của the blind man with the clay ,
và nói unto him ,
Go , wash in the pool
của Siloam ,
( which is by interpretation , Sent .) He went his way therefore , và washed , và came seeing .
The neighbours therefore , và
they which
before had seen him that he was blind , nói , Is not this
he that sat và begged ?
Some nói ,
This is he : others nói ,
He is like him : but he nói ,
I am he .
Therefore said they unto him , How were thine eyes opened ?
He answered và nói , A man that is called Đức Giê-su made clay , và anointed mine eyes , và nói unto me , Go to the pool
của Siloam , và wash : và I went và washed , và I received sight .
Then said they unto him , Where is he ? He nói , I know not .
They brought to the Pharisees him
that aforetime was blind .
và it was the sabbath day when Đức Giê-su made the clay , và opened his eyes .
Then again the Pharisees also asked him how he had received his sight .
He nói unto them , He put clay upon mine eyes , và I washed , và do see .
Therefore nói some của the Pharisees , This man is not của Chúa , because he keepeth not the sabbath day . Others nói , How can a man that is a sinner do such miracles ? và there was a division among them .
They say
unto the blind man again , What sayest thou của him , that he hath opened thine eyes ?
He nói ,
He is một tiên-tri .
But
the Dân Do-thái did not believe concerning him , that he had been blind , và received his sight , until
they called the parents của him
that had received his sight .
và they asked them , saying , Is this your son , who ye say
was born blind ? how then doth he now see ?
His parents answered them và nói , We know that this is our son , và that he was born blind :
But by what means he now seeth , we know not ; or who hath opened his eyes , we know not : he is of age ; ask him : he shall speak for himself .
These words spake his parents , because they feared
the Dân Do-thái : for
the Dân Do-thái had agreed already , that nếu any man did confess that he was Christ , he should be put out of the synagogue .
Therefore
nói his parents ,
He is của age ; ask him .
Then again
called they the man that was blind , và nói unto him , Give Chúa the praise : we know that this man is a sinner .
He answered và nói , Whether he be a sinner or no , I know not : one thing I know , that , whereas I was blind , now I see .
Then said they to him again , What did he to thee ? how opened he thine eyes ?
He answered them , I have told you already , và ye did not hear : wherefore would ye hear it again ?
will ye also be his các môn đệ ?
Then they reviled him , và nói , Thou art his disciple ; but we are Môi-se' các môn đệ .
We know that Chúa spake unto Môi-se :
as for
this fellow , we know not from whence he is .
The man answered và nói unto them , Why herein
is a marvellous thing , that ye know not from whence he is , và yet he hath opened mine eyes .
Now we know that Chúa heareth not sinners : but nếu any man be a worshipper of Đức Chúa Trời , và doeth his will , him he heareth .
Since the world began was it not heard that any man opened the eyes của one that was born blind .
nếu this man were not của Chúa , he could do nothing .
They answered và nói unto him , Thou wast altogether born in sins , và dost thou teach us ? và they cast him out .
Đức Giê-su heard that they had cast him out ; và when he had found him , he nói unto him ,
Dost thou believe on con trai của Đức Chúa Trời ?
He answered và nói , Who is he , Lord , that I might believe on him ?
và Đức Giê-su nói unto him ,
Thou hast both seen him , và
it is he that talketh with thee .
và he nói , Lord , I believe . và he worshipped him .
và Đức Giê-su nói ,
For judgment I am come into this world , that
they which see not might see ; và
that they which see might be made blind .
và some của the Pharisees
which were with him heard these words , và nói unto him ,
Are we blind also ?
Đức Giê-su nói unto them ,
nếu ye were blind ,
ye should have no sin : but now ye say ,
We see ;
therefore your sin remaineth .

CHAPTER 10.
Verily , verily , I say unto you , He that entereth not by the door into the chiênfold , but climbeth up some other way , the same is a thief và a robber .
"???????????????????" literally, "the house of the chiên"
But he that entereth in by the door is the shepherd của the chiên .
To him the porter openeth ; và the chiên hear his voice : và he calleth his own chiên by name , và leadeth them out .
và when he putteth forth his own chiên , he goeth before them , và the chiên follow him : for they know his voice .
và a stranger will they not follow , but will flee from him : for they know not the voice của strangers .
Double negatives intensify negation in Greek. "?????????????????" literally, "shall not not follow"
This parable spake Đức Giê-su unto them : but they understood not what things they were which he spake unto them .
Then nói Đức Giê-su unto them again ,
Verily , verily , I say unto you , I am the door của the chiên .
All that ever came before me are thieves và robbers : but the chiên did not hear them .
I am the door : by me nếu any man enter in , he shall be saved , và shall go in và out , và find pasture .
The thief cometh not , but for to steal , và to kill , và to destroy : I am come that they might have life , và that they might have it more abundantly .
I am the good shepherd : the good shepherd giveth his life for the chiên .
But he that is an hireling , và not the shepherd , whose own the chiên are not , seeth the wolf coming , và leaveth the chiên , và fleeth : và the wolf catcheth them , và scattereth the chiên .
The hireling fleeth , because he is an hireling , và careth not for the chiên .
I am the good shepherd , và know my chiên , và am known của mine .
As the Father knoweth me , even so know I the Father : và I lay down my life for the chiên .
và other chiên I have , which are not của this fold : them also I must bring , và they shall hear my voice ; và there shall be một fold , và một shepherd .
Therefore doth my Father love me , because I lay down my life , that I might take it again .
No man taketh it from me , but I lay it down của myself . I have power to lay it down , và I have power to take it again . This commandment have I received của my Father .
There was a division therefore again among the Dân Do-thái for these sayings .
và many of them nói , He hath a devil , và is mad ; why hear ye him ?
Others nói , These are not the words của him that hath a devil . Can a devil open the eyes của the blind ?
và it was at Giê-ru-sa-lem the feast of the dedication , và it was winter .
và Đức Giê-su walked in đền thờ in Sa-lô-môn's porch .
Then came the Dân Do-thái round about him , và nói unto him , How long dost thou make us to doubt ? nếu thou be the Christ , tell us plainly .
Đức Giê-su answered them ,
I told you , và ye believed not : the works that I do in my Father's name , they bear witness của me .
But ye believe not , because ye are not của my chiên , as I nói unto you .
My chiên hear my voice , và I know them , và they follow me :
và I give unto them eternal life ; và they shall never perish , neither shall any man pluck them out of my hand .
My Father , which gave them me , is greater than all ; và no man is able to pluck them out of my Father's hand .
I và my Father are một .
Then the Dân Do-thái took up stones again to stone him .
Đức Giê-su answered them ,
Many good works have I shewed you from my Father ; for which của those works do ye stone me ?
The Dân Do-thái answered him , saying , For a good work we stone thee not ; but for blasphemy ; và because that thou , being a man , makest thyself Chúa .
Đức Giê-su answered them ,
Is it not written in your law , I nói , Ye are những thần ?
nếu he called them những thần , unto whom the word của Đức Chúa Trời came , và the scripture can not be broken ;
Say ye của him, whom the Father hath sanctified , và sent into the world , Thou blasphemest ; because I nói , I am con trai của Đức Chúa Trời ?
nếu I do not the works của my Father , believe me not .
But nếu I do , though ye believe not me , believe the works : that ye may know , và believe , that the Father is in me , và I in him .
The verb "to be" in the phrase "[T]he Father is in me…" is unstated in the Greek.
Therefore they sought again to take him : but he escaped out of their hand ,
và went away again beyond Jordan into the place where John at first baptized ; và there he abode .
và many resorted unto him , và nói , John did no miracle : but all things that John spake của this man were true .
và many believed on him there .

CHAPTER 11.
Now a certain man was sick , named Lazarus , của Bethany , the town của Mary và her sister Martha .
( It was that Mary which anointed Đức Chúa Trời with ointment , và wiped his feet with her hair , whose brother Lazarus was sick .)
Therefore his sisters sent unto him , saying , Lord , Kìa , he whom thou lovest is sick .
When Đức Giê-su heard that , he nói ,
This sickness is not unto death , but for the glory của Đức Chúa Trời , that con trai của Đức Chúa Trời might be glorified thereby .
Now Đức Giê-su đã yêu Martha , và her sister , và Lazarus .
When he had heard therefore that he was sick , he abode hai days still in the same place where he was .
Then after that saith he to his các môn đệ ,
Let us go into Judæa again .
His các môn đệ say unto him , Master , the Dân Do-thái của late sought to stone thee ; và goest thou thither again ?
Đức Giê-su answered ,
Are there not twelve hours trong the day ? nếu any man walk in the day , he stumbleth not , because he seeth ánh sáng của this world .
But nếu a man walk in the night , he stumbleth , because there is no light in him .
These things said he : và after that he saith unto them ,
Our friend Lazarus sleepeth ; but I go , that I may awake him out of sleep .
Then nói his các môn đệ , Lord , nếu he sleep , he shall do well .
Howbeit Đức Giê-su spake của his death : but they thought that he had spoken của taking of rest trong sleep .
Then nói Đức Giê-su unto them plainly ,
Lazarus is dead .
và I am glad for your sakes that I was not there , to the intent ye may believe ; nevertheless let us go unto him .
Then nói Thomas , which is called Didymus , unto his fellowdisciples , Let us also go , that we may die with him .
Then when Đức Giê-su came , he found that he had lain in the grave bốn days already .
Now Bethany was nigh unto Giê-ru-sa-lem , about fifteen furlongs off :
và many của the Dân Do-thái came to Martha và Mary , to comfort them concerning their brother .
Then Martha , as soon as she heard that Đức Giê-su was coming , went và met him : but Mary sat still in the house .
Then nói Martha unto Đức Giê-su , Lord , nếu thou hadst been here , my brother had not chết .
But I know , that even now , whatsoever thou wilt ask của Đức Chúa Trời , Chúa will give it thee .
Đức Giê-su saith unto her ,
Thy brother shall rise again .
Martha saith unto him , I know that he shall rise again in the resurrection at the last ngày .
Đức Giê-su nói unto her ,
I am the resurrection , và the life : he that believeth in me , though he were dead , yet shall he live :
và whosoever liveth và believeth in me shall never die . Believest thou this ?
She saith unto him , Yea , Lord : I believe that thou art the Christ , con trai của Đức Chúa Trời , which should come into the world .
và when she had so nói , she went her way , và gọi Mary her sister secretly , saying , The Master is come , và calleth for thee .
As soon as she heard that , she arose quickly , và came unto him .
Now Đức Giê-su was not yet come into the town , but was in that place where Martha met him .
The Dân Do-thái then which were with her in the house , và comforted her , when they saw Mary , that she rose up hastily và went out , followed her , saying , She goeth unto the grave to weep there .
Then when Mary was come where Đức Giê-su was , và thấy him , she fell down at his feet , saying unto him , Lord , nếu thou hadst been here , my brother had not chết .
When Đức Giê-su therefore thấy her weeping , và the Dân Do-thái also weeping which came with her , he groaned trong the spirit , và was troubled ,
và nói ,
Where have ye laid him ?
They nói unto him , Lord , come và see .
Đức Giê-su wept .
Then nói the Dân Do-thái , Kìa how he đã yêu him !
và some của them nói , Could not this man , which opened the eyes của the blind , have caused that even this man should not have chết ?
Đức Giê-su therefore again groaning in himself cometh to the grave . It was a cave , và a stone lay upon it .
Đức Giê-su nói ,
Take ye away the stone .
Martha , the sister của him that was dead , saith unto him , Lord , by this time he stinketh : for he hath been dead bốn days .
Đức Giê-su saith unto her ,
Said I not unto thee , that , nếu thou wouldest believe , thou shouldest see the glory của Đức Chúa Trời ?
Then they took away the stone from the place where the dead was laid . và Đức Giê-su lifted up his eyes , và nói ,
Father , I thank thee that thou hast heard me .
và I knew that thou hearest me always : but because of the people which stand by I nói it , that they may believe that thou hast sent me .
và when he thus had spoken , he cried with a loud voice ,
Lazarus , come forth .
và he that was dead came forth , bound hand và foot with graveclothes : và his face was bound about with a napkin . Đức Giê-su saith unto them ,
Loose him , và let him go .
Then many của the Dân Do-thái which came to Mary , và had seen the things which Đức Giê-su did , believed on him .
But some của them went their ways to the Pharisees , và told them what things Đức Giê-su had done .
Then gathered the chief priests và the Pharisees a council , và nói , What do we ? for this man doeth many miracles .
nếu we let him thus alone , all men will believe on him : và the Romans shall come và take away both our place và nation .
và một của them , named Cai-phe , being thầy cả thượng-phẩm that same year , nói unto them , Ye know nothing at all ,
Nor consider that it is expedient for us , that một man should die for the people , và that the whole nation perish not .
và this spake he not của himself : but being thầy cả thượng-phẩm that year , he prophesied that Đức Giê-su should die for that nation ;
và not for that nation only , but that also he should gather together in một the children của Đức Chúa Trời that were scattered abroad .
Then from that ngày forth they took counsel together for to put him to death .
Đức Giê-su therefore walked no more openly among the Dân Do-thái ; but went thence unto a country near to the wilderness , into a city gọi Ephraim , và there continued with his các môn đệ .
và the Dân Do-thái' passover was nigh at hand : và many went out of the country up to Giê-ru-sa-lem before the passover , to purify themselves .
Then sought they for Đức Giê-su , và spake among themselves , as they stood in đền thờ , What think ye , that he will not come to the feast ?
Now both the chief priests và the Pharisees had given a commandment , that , nếu any man knew where he were , he should shew it , that they might take him .

CHAPTER 12.
Then Đức Giê-su sáu days before the passover came to Bethany , where Lazarus was which had been dead , whom he raised from the dead .
There they made him a supper ; và Martha served : but Lazarus was một của them that sat at the table with him .
Then took Mary a pound của ointment của spikenard , very costly , và anointed the feet của Đức Giê-su , và wiped his feet with her hair : và the house was filled with the odour của the ointment .
Then saith một của his các môn đệ , Judas Iscariot , Simon's son , which should betray him ,
Why was not this ointment sold for ba (3) hundred pence , và given to the poor ?
This he nói , not that he cared for the poor ; but because he was a thief , và had the bag , và bare what was put therein .
Then nói Đức Giê-su ,
Let her alone : against the day của my burying hath she kept this .
For the poor always ye have with you ; but me ye have not always .
Much people của the Dân Do-thái therefore knew that he was there : và they came not for Đức Giê-su' sake only , but that they might see Lazarus also , whom he had raised from the dead .
But the chief priests consulted that they might put Lazarus also to death ;
Because that by reason of him many của the Dân Do-thái went away , và believed on Đức Giê-su .
On the next day much people that were come to the feast , when they heard that Đức Giê-su was coming to Giê-ru-sa-lem ,
Took branches của palm trees , và went forth to meet him , và cried , Hosanna : Blessed is the King của Y-sơ-ra-ên that cometh in the name của the Lord .
và Đức Giê-su , when he had found a young ass , sat thereon ; as it is written ,
Fear not , daughter của Sion : Kìa , thy King cometh , sitting on an ass's colt .
These things understood not his các môn đệ at the first : but when Đức Giê-su was glorified , then remembered they that these things were written của him , và that they had done these things unto him .
The people therefore that was with him when he called Lazarus out of his grave , và raised him from the dead , bare record .
For this cause the people also met him , for that they heard that he had done this miracle .
The Pharisees therefore nói among themselves , Perceive ye how ye prevail
nothing ? Kìa , the world is gone after him .
và there were certain Greeks among them that came up to worship at the feast :
The same came therefore to Philip , which was of Bethsaida của Galilee , và desired him , saying , Sir , we would see Đức Giê-su .
Philip cometh và telleth An-rê : và again An-rê và Philip tell Đức Giê-su .
và Đức Giê-su answered them , saying ,
The hour is come , that con trai của man should be glorified .
Verily , verily , I say unto you , Except a corn của wheat fall into the ground và die , it abideth alone : but nếu it die , it bringeth forth much fruit .
He that loveth his life shall lose it ; và he that hateth his life in this world shall keep it unto life eternal .
nếu any man serve me , let him follow me ; và where I am , there shall also my đầy tớ be : nếu any man serve me , him will my Father honour .
Now is my soul troubled ; và what shall I say ? Father , save me from this hour : but for this cause came I unto this hour .
Father , glorify thy name .
Then came there a voice from heaven , saying , I have both glorified it , và will glorify it again .
The people therefore , that stood by , và heard it , said that it thundered : others nói , An angel spake to him .
Đức Giê-su answered và nói ,
This voice came not because của me , but for your sakes .
Now is the judgment của this world : now shall the prince của this world be cast out .
và I , nếu I be lifted up from the earth , will draw all men unto me .
This he nói , signifying what death he should die .
The people answered him , We have heard out của the law that Christ abideth for ever : và how sayest thou , con trai của man must be lifted up ? who is this Son của man ?
Then Đức Giê-su nói unto them ,
Yet a little while is ánh sáng with you . Walk while ye have ánh sáng , lest darkness come upon you : for he that walketh in darkness knoweth not whither he goeth .
While ye have light , believe in ánh sáng , that ye may be the children của light .
These things spake Đức Giê-su , và departed , và did hide himself from them .
But though he had done so many miracles before them , yet they believed not on him :
That the saying của Esaias the prophet might be fulfilled , which he spake , Lord , who hath believed our report ? và to whom hath the arm của the Lord been revealed ?
Therefore they could not believe , because that Esaias nói again ,
He hath blinded their eyes , và hardened their heart ; that they should not see with their eyes , nor understand with their heart , và be converted , và I should heal them .
These things nói Esaias , when he saw his glory , và spake của him .
Nevertheless among the chief rulers also many believed on him ; but because của the Pharisees they did not confess him , lest they should be put out of the synagogue :
For they đã yêu the praise của men more than the praise của Đức Chúa Trời .
Đức Giê-su cried và nói ,
He that believeth on me , believeth not on me , but on him that sent me .
và he that seeth me seeth him that sent me .
I am come a light into the world , that whosoever believeth on me should not abide in darkness .
và nếu any man hear my words , và believe not , I judge him not : for I came not to judge the world , but to save the world .
He that rejecteth me , và receiveth not my words , hath one that judgeth him : the word that I have spoken , the same shall judge him in the last ngày .
For I have not spoken của myself ; but the Father which sent me , he gave me a commandment , what I should say , và what I should speak .
và I know that his commandment is life everlasting : whatsoever I speak therefore , even as the Father nói unto me , so I speak .

CHAPTER 13.
Now before the feast của the passover , when Đức Giê-su knew that his hour was come that he should depart out of this world unto the Father , having đã yêu his own which were in the world , he đã yêu them unto the end . when Đức Giê-su
và supper being ended , the devil having now put into the heart của Judas Iscariot , Simon's son , to betray him ;
Đức Giê-su knowing that the Father had given all things into his hands , và that he was come from Chúa , và went to Chúa ;
He riseth from supper , và laid aside his garments ; và took a towel , và girded himself . his garments và girded
After that he poureth nước into a bason , và began to wash các môn đệ' feet , và to wipe them with the towel wherewith he was girded .
Then cometh he to Simon Phi-e-rơ : và Peter saith unto him ,
Lord , dost thou wash my feet ?
Đức Giê-su answered và nói unto him ,
What I do thou knowest not now ; but thou shalt know hereafter .
Phi-e-rơ saith unto him , Thou shalt
never wash my feet . Đức Giê-su answered him ,
nếu I wash thee not , thou hast no part with me .
ου μη
Simon Phi-e-rơ saith unto him , Lord , not my feet only , but also my hands và my head .
Đức Giê-su saith to him ,
He that is washed needeth not save to wash his
feet , but is clean every whit : và ye are clean , but not all .
η - tag 10
For he knew who should betray him ; therefore
said he , Ye are not all clean .
So after he had washed their feet , và had taken his garments , và was set down again , he nói unto them ,
Know ye
what I have done to you ?
tag 17 - has no greek word tag 12 "and was set down"
Ye call me Master và Lord : và ye say well ; for so I am .
nếu I then , your Lord và Master , have washed your feet ; ye also ought to wash one another's feet .
For I have given you an example , that
ye should do as I have done to you . tag 10?
Verily , verily , I say unto you , The servant is not greater than his lord ; neither he that is sent greater than he that sent him .
nếu ye know these things , happy are ye nếu ye do them .
I speak not của you all : I know whom I have chosen : but that the scripture may be fulfilled , He that eateth bread with me hath lifted up his heel against me .
Now I tell you before it come , that , when it is come to pass , ye may believe that I am he .
Verily , verily , I say unto you , He tha t receiveth
whomsoever I send receiveth me ; và he that receiveth me receiveth him that sent me .
tag 8
When Đức Giê-su had thus nói , he was troubled trong spirit , và testified , và nói ,
Verily , verily , I say unto you , that một của you shall betray me .
When Đức Giê-su
Then các môn đệ looked một on another , doubting của whom he spake .
Now there was leaning on Đức Giê-su' bosom một của his các môn đệ , whom Đức Giê-su đã yêu . tag 1 "there was"
Simon Phi-e-rơ therefore beckoned to him , that he should ask who
it should be của whom he spake .
He then lying on Đức Giê-su' breast saith unto him , Lord , who is it ?
Đức Giê-su answered ,
He it is , to whom I shall give a sop , when I have dipped it .
và when he had dipped the sop , he gave it to Judas Iscariot , con trai của Simon .
và after the sop Satan entered into him . Then nói Đức Giê-su
unto him ,
That thou doest , do quickly .
tag 12
Now no man at the table knew
for what intent he spake this unto him . Tag 7 và 8 - for waht intent
For some của them thought , because Judas had the bag , that Đức Giê-su had nói unto him , Buy those things that we have need của against the feast ; or , that he should give something to the poor .
He then having received the sop went immediately out : và it was đêm .
Therefore , when he was gone out , Đức Giê-su nói ,
Now is con trai của man glorified , và Chúa is glorified in him .
nếu Chúa be glorified in him , Chúa shall also glorify him in himself , và shall straightway glorify him .
Little children , yet a little while I am with you . Ye shall seek me : và as I nói unto the Dân Do-thái ,
Whither I go , ye
cannot come ; so now I say to you . tag 14 tag 19
A new commandment I give unto you , That ye love one another ; as I have đã yêu you , that ye also love one another .
By this shall all men know that ye are my các môn đệ , nếu ye have love một to another .
Simon Phi-e-rơ nói unto him , Lord , whither goest thou ? Đức Giê-su answered him ,
Whither I go , thou canst not follow me now ; but thou shalt follow me afterwards .
Phi-e-rơ nói unto him , Lord ,
why
cannot I follow thee now ? I will lay down my life for thy sake . tag 6 tag 8
Đức Giê-su answered him ,
Wilt thou lay down thy life for my sake ? Verily , verily , I say unto thee , The cock shall not
crow , till
thou hast denied me thrice .
tag 16 tag 20

CHAPTER 14.
Let not your heart be troubled : ye believe in Chúa , believe also in me .
tags 6 và 7 are the same word - πιστευετε tags 14 và 15 are the same word - πιστευετε
In my Father's house are many mansions : nếu it were
not so , I would have told
you . I go to prepare a place for you . tag 14
và nếu I go và prepare a place for you , I will come again , và receive you unto myself ; that where I am , there ye may be also .
và whither I go ye know , và the way ye know .
Thomas saith unto him , Lord , we know not whither thou goest ; và how can we know the way ?
Đức Giê-su saith unto him ,
I am the way ,
the truth , và the life : no man cometh unto the Father ,
but by me . tag 9 tag 20
nếu ye had known me , ye should have known
my Father also : và from henceforth ye know him , và have seen him .
tag 9
Philip saith unto him , Lord , shew us the Father , và it sufficeth us .
Đức Giê-su saith unto him ,
Have I been so long time with you , và yet hast thou not known me , Philip ? he that hath seen me hath seen the Father ; và how sayest thou then , Shew us the Father ?
Believest thou not that I am in the Father , và the Father in me ? the words that I speak unto you I speak not của myself : but the Father that dwelleth in me , he doeth the works .
Believe me that I am in the Father , và the Father in me : or else
believe me for the very works' sake . tag 15 tag 18
Verily , verily , I say unto you , He that believeth on me , the works that I do shall he do also ; và greater works than these shall he do ; because I go unto my Father . tag 5
và
whatsoever ye shall ask in my name , that will I do , that the Father may be glorified in con trai .
nếu ye shall ask any thing in my name , I will do it.
nếu ye love me , keep my commandments .
và I will pray the Father , và he shall give you another Comforter , that he may abide with you for ever ;
Even the Spirit của truth ; whom the world
cannot receive , because it seeth him not , neither knoweth him : but ye know him ; for he dwelleth with you , và shall be in you .
I will not leave you comfortless : I will come to you .
Yet a little while , và the world seeth me no more ; but ye see me : because I live , ye shall live also .
At that ngày ye shall know that I am in my Father , và ye in me , và I in you .
He that hath my commandments , và keepeth them , he it is that loveth me : và he that loveth me shall be đã yêu của my Father , và I will love him , và will manifest myself to him .
tags 1,11 và 14
Judas saith unto him , not Iscariot , Lord , how is it that thou wilt manifest thyself unto us , và not unto the world ?
Đức Giê-su answered và nói unto him ,
nếu a man love me , he will keep my words : và my Father will love him , và we will come unto him , và make our abode with him . tag 26
He that loveth me not keepeth not my sayings : và the word which ye hear is not mine , but the Father's which sent me . tag 1
These things have I spoken unto you , being yet present with you .
But the Comforter , which is the Holy Ghost , whom the Father will send in my name , he shall teach you all things , và bring all things to your remembrance , whatsoever I have nói unto you . tags 21 và 22
Peace I leave with you , my peace I give unto you : not as the world giveth , give I unto you . Let not your heart be troubled , neither let it be afraid .
Ye have heard how I nói unto you , I go away , và come again unto you . nếu ye đã yêu me , ye would rejoice ,
because I nói , I go unto the Father : for my Father is greater than I . tags 15 và 27
và now I have told you before it come to pass , that , when it is come to pass , ye might believe .
Hereafter I will not talk much with you : for the prince của this world cometh , và hath
nothing in me . tag 17
But that the world may know that I love the Father ; và as the Father gave me commandment , even so I do . Arise , let us go hence .

chapter.title: CHAPTER 15.
chapter.q:
I am the true vine , và my Father is the husbandman .
Every branch in me that beareth not fruit he taketh away : và every branch that beareth fruit , he purgeth it , that it may bring forth more fruit .
Now ye are clean through the word which I have spoken unto you .
Abide in me , và I in you . As the branch
cannot bear fruit của itself , except
it abide in the vine ;
no more can ye , except
ye abide in me .
I am the vine , ye are the branches : He that abideth in me , và I in him , the same bringeth forth much fruit : for without me
ye can do nothing .
nếu a man abide not in me , he is cast forth as a branch , và is withered ; và men gather them , và cast them into the fire , và they are burned .
nếu ye abide in me , và my words abide in you , ye shall ask what
ye will , và it shall be done unto you .
Herein is my Father glorified , that ye bear much fruit ; so shall ye be my các môn đệ .
As the Father hath đã yêu me , so have I đã yêu you : continue ye in my love .
nếu ye keep my commandments , ye shall abide in my love ; even as I have kept my Father's commandments , và abide in his love .
These things have I spoken unto you , that my joy might remain in you , và that your joy might be full .
This is my commandment , That ye love one another , as I have đã yêu you .
Greater love hath no man than this , that a man lay down his life for his friends .
Ye are my friends , nếu ye do whatsoever I command you .
Henceforth I call you not những đầy tớ ; for the servant knoweth not what his lord doeth : but I have called you friends ; for all things that I have heard của my Father I have made known unto you .
Ye have not chosen me , but I have chosen you , và ordained you , that ye should go và bring forth fruit , và that your fruit should remain : that
whatsoever ye shall ask của the Father in my name , he may give it you .
These things I command you , that ye love one another .
nếu the world hate you , ye know that it hated me before it hated you .
NOTE! Extra word: "ginosko"
nếu ye were của the world , the world would love
his own : but because ye are not của the world , but I have chosen you out of the world , therefore
the world hateth you .
Remember the word that I nói unto you , The servant is not greater than his lord . nếu they have persecuted me , they will also persecute you ; nếu they have kept my saying , they will keep yours also .
But all these things will they do unto you for my name's sake , because they know not him that sent me .
nếu I had not come và spoken unto them , they had not had sin : but now they have no cloke for their sin .
He that hateth me hateth my Father also .
nếu I had not done among them the works which none other man did , they had not had sin : but now have they both seen và hated both me và my Father .
But this cometh to pass , that the word might be fulfilled that is written in their law ,
They hated me without a cause .
But when the Comforter is come , whom I will send unto you from the Father , even the Spirit của truth , which proceedeth from the Father , he shall testify của me :
và ye also shall bear witness , because ye have been with me from the beginning .

div.chapter:
CHAPTER 16.
These things have I spoken unto you , that ye should not be offended .
They shall put you out of the synagogues : yea , the time cometh , that whosoever killeth you will think that he doeth Chúa service .
và these things will they do unto you , because they have not known the Father , nor me .
But these things have I told you , that when the time shall come , ye may remember that I told you của them . và these things I nói not unto you at the beginning , because I was with you .
But now I go my way to him that sent me ; và none của you asketh me , Whither goest thou ?
But because I have nói these things unto you , sorrow hath filled your heart .
Nevertheless I tell you the truth ; It is expedient for you that I go away : for nếu I go not away , the Comforter will not come unto you ; but nếu I depart , I will send him unto you .
và when he is come , he will reprove the world của sin , và của sự công chính , và của judgment :
của sin ,
because they believe not on me ;
của sự công chính , because I go to my Father , và ye see me no more ;
của judgment , because the prince của this world is judged .
I have yet many things to say unto you , but
ye cannot bear them now .
Howbeit when he , the Spirit of truth , is come , he will guide you into all truth : for he shall not speak của himself ; but whatsoever
he shall hear , that shall he speak : và he will shew you things to come .
He shall glorify me : for he shall receive của mine , và shall shew it unto you .
All things that the Father hath are mine : therefore
said I , that he shall take của mine , và shall shew it unto you .
A little while , và ye shall not see me : và again , a little while , và ye shall see me , because I go to the Father .
Then nói some của his các môn đệ among themselves , What is this that he saith unto us , A little while , và ye shall not see me : và again , a little while , và ye shall see me : và , Because I go to the Father ?
They nói therefore , What is this that he saith , A little while ? we cannot tell what he saith .
Now Đức Giê-su knew that they were desirous to ask him , và nói unto them ,
Do ye enquire among yourselves của
that I nói , A little while , và ye shall not see me : và again , a little while , và ye shall see me ?
Verily , verily , I say unto you , That ye shall weep và lament , but the world shall rejoice : và ye shall be sorrowful , but your sorrow shall be turned into joy .
A woman when she is in travail hath sorrow , because her hour is come : but as soon as she is delivered của the child , she remembereth no more the anguish , for joy that a man is born into the world .
và ye now therefore
have sorrow : but I will see you again , và your heart shall rejoice , và your joy no man taketh from you .
và in that ngày ye shall ask
me nothing . Verily , verily , I say unto you ,
Whatsoever ye shall ask the Father in my name , he will give it you .
Hitherto
have ye asked
nothing in my name : ask , và ye shall receive , that your joy may be full .
These things have I spoken unto you in proverbs : but the time cometh , when I shall no more speak unto you in proverbs , but I shall shew you plainly của the Father .
At that ngày ye shall ask in my name : và I say not unto you , that I will pray the Father for you :
For the Father himself loveth you , because ye have đã yêu me , và have believed that I came out from Chúa .
I came forth from the Father , và am come into the world : again , I leave the world , và go to the Father .
His các môn đệ said unto him , Lo , now speakest thou plainly , và speakest no proverb .
Now are we sure that thou knowest all things , và
needest not that any man should ask thee : by this we believe that thou camest forth from Chúa .
Đức Giê-su answered them ,
Do ye now believe ?
Kìa , the hour cometh , yea , is now come , that ye shall be scattered , every man to his own , và shall leave me alone : và yet I am not alone , because the Father is with me .
These things I have spoken unto you , that in me ye might have peace . In the world ye shall have tribulation : but be of good cheer ; I have overcome the world .

CHAPTER 17.
These words spake Đức Giê-su , và lifted up his eyes to heaven , và nói ,
Father , the hour is come ; glorify thy Son , that thy Son also may glorify thee :
As thou hast given him power over all flesh , that he should give eternal life to as many as thou hast given him .
và this is life eternal , that they might know thee the only true Chúa , và Đức Giê-su Christ , whom thou hast sent .
I have glorified thee on the earth : I have finished the work which thou gavest me to do .
và now , O Father , glorify thou me with thine own self with the glory which I had with thee before the world was .
I have manifested thy name unto the men which thou gavest me out of the world : thine they were , và thou gavest them me ; và they have kept thy word .
Now they have known that all things whatsoever thou hast given me are của thee .
For I have given unto them the words which thou gavest me ; và they have received them , và have known surely that I came out from thee , và they have believed that thou didst send me .
I pray for them : I pray not for the world , but for them which thou hast given me ; for they are thine .
và all mine are thine , và thine are mine ; và I am glorified in them .
và now I am no more in the world , but these are in the world , và I come to thee . Holy Father , keep through thine own name those whom thou hast given me , that they may be một , as we are .
While I was with them in the world , I kept them in thy name : those that thou gavest me I have kept , và none của them is lost , but
con trai của perdition ; that the scripture might be fulfilled .
và now come I to thee ; và these things I speak in the world , that they might have my joy fulfilled in themselves .
I have given them thy word ; và the world hath hated them , because they are not của the world , even as I am not của the world .
I pray not that thou shouldest take them out of the world , but that thou shouldest keep them from the evil .
They are not của the world , even as I am not của the world .
Sanctify them through thy truth : thy word is truth .
As thou hast sent me into the world , even so have I also sent them into the world .
và for their sakes I sanctify myself , that they also might be sanctified through the truth .
Neither pray I for these alone , but for them also which shall believe on me through their word ;
That they all may be một ; as thou , Father , art in me , và I in thee , that they also may be một in us : that the world may believe that thou hast sent me .
và the glory which thou gavest me I have given them ; that they may be một , even as we are một :
I in them , và thou in me , that they may be made perfect in một ; và that the world may know that thou hast sent me , và hast đã yêu them , as thou hast đã yêu me .
Father , I will that they also , whom thou hast given me , be with me where I am ; that they may behold my glory , which thou hast given me : for thou đã yêust me before the foundation của the world .
O righteous Father ,
the world hath not known thee : but I have known thee , và these have known that thou hast sent me .
và I have declared unto them thy name , và will declare it : that the love wherewith thou hast đã yêu me may be in them , và I in them .

CHAPTER 18.
When Đức Giê-su had spoken these words , he went forth with his các môn đệ over the brook Cedron , where was a garden , into the which he entered , và his các môn đệ .
và Judas also , which betrayed him , knew the place : for Đức Giê-su ofttimes resorted thither with his các môn đệ .
Judas then , having received a band của men và officers from the chief priests và người Pha-ri-si , cometh thither with lanterns và torches và weapons .
Đức Giê-su therefore , knowing all things that should come upon him , went forth , và nói unto them ,
Whom seek ye ?
They answered him , Đức Giê-su của Nazareth . Đức Giê-su saith unto them ,
I am he .
và Judas also , which betrayed him , stood with them .
As soon then as he had nói unto them ,
I am he , they went
backward , và fell to the ground .
Then asked he them again ,
Whom seek ye ?
và they nói , Đức Giê-su của Nazareth .
Đức Giê-su answered ,
I have told you that I am he : nếu therefore ye seek me , let these go their way :
That the saying might be fulfilled , which he spake ,
của them which thou gavest me
have I lost none .
Then Simon Phi-e-rơ having a sword drew it , và smote thầy cả thượng-phẩm's đầy tớ , và cut off his right ear .
The servant's name was Malchus .
Then nói Đức Giê-su unto Peter ,
Put up thy sword into the sheath : the cup which my Father hath given me , shall I not
drink it ?
UNSURE: There is no posessive pronoun "mou" to justify "my" of "my father", so I used the definate article.
Then the band và the captain và officers của the Dân Do-thái took Đức Giê-su , và bound him ,
và led him away to Annas first ; for he was father in law to Cai-phe , which was thầy cả thượng-phẩm that same year .
Now Cai-phe was he, which gave counsel to the Dân Do-thái , that it was expedient that một man should die for the people .
và Simon Phi-e-rơ followed Đức Giê-su , và so did another disciple : that
disciple was known unto thầy cả thượng-phẩm , và went in with Đức Giê-su into the palace của thầy cả thượng-phẩm .
But Phi-e-rơ stood at the door without . Then went out that other disciple , which was known unto thầy cả thượng-phẩm , và spake unto her that kept the door , và brought in Phi-e-rơ .
Then saith the damsel that kept the door unto Peter , Art not thou also một của this man's các môn đệ ? He saith , I am not .
và những đầy tớ và officers stood there , who had made a fire of coals ; for it was cold : và they warmed themselves : và Phi-e-rơ
stood with them , và warmed himself .
thầy cả thượng-phẩm then asked Đức Giê-su của his các môn đệ , và của his doctrine .
Đức Giê-su answered him ,
I spake openly to the world ; I ever taught in the synagogue , và in đền thờ , whither the Dân Do-thái always resort ; và in secret have I nói nothing .
Why askest thou me ? ask them which heard me , what I have nói unto them : Kìa , they know what I nói .
và when he had thus spoken , một của the officers which stood by struck Đức Giê-su with the palm of his hand , saying , Answerest thou thầy cả thượng-phẩm so ?
Đức Giê-su answered him ,
nếu I have spoken evil , bear witness của the evil : but nếu well , why smitest thou me ?
Now Annas had sent him bound unto Cai-phe thầy cả thượng-phẩm .
và Simon Phi-e-rơ
stood và warmed himself . They nói therefore unto him , Art not thou also một của his các môn đệ ? He denied it , và nói , I am not .
một của những đầy tớ của thầy cả thượng-phẩm , being his kinsman whose ear Phi-e-rơ cut off , saith , Did not I see thee in the garden with him ?
Phi-e-rơ then denied again : và immediately the cock crew .
Then led they Đức Giê-su from Cai-phe unto the hall of judgment : và it was early ; và they themselves went not into the judgment hall , lest
they should be defiled ; but that they might eat the passover .
Phi-láte then went out unto them , và nói , What accusation bring ye against this man ?
They answered và nói unto him , nếu he were not a malefactor , we would not
have delivered him up unto thee .
Since we can only split a verb once, we are denied the more accurate tagging of the prepositional portion of "paradidomi" in favor of the necessary inclusion of the percác con trai of the verb.
Then nói Phi-láte unto them , Take ye him , và judge him according to your law . The Dân Do-thái therefore said unto him , It is not lawful for us to put any man to death :
That the saying của Đức Giê-su might be fulfilled , which he spake , signifying what death he should die .
Then Phi-láte entered into the judgment hall again , và gọi Đức Giê-su , và nói unto him , Art thou the King của the Dân Do-thái ?
Đức Giê-su answered him ,
Sayest thou this thing của thyself , or did others tell it thee của me ?
Phi-láte answered ,
Am I a Jew ? Thine own nation và the chief priests have delivered thee unto me : what hast thou done ?
Đức Giê-su answered ,
My kingdom is not của this world : nếu my kingdom were của this world , then would my những đầy tớ fight , that I should not be delivered to the Dân Do-thái : but now is my kingdom not from hence .
Phi-láte therefore nói unto him , Art thou a king then ? Đức Giê-su answered ,
Thou sayest that I am a king . To this end was I born , và for this cause came I into the world , that I should bear witness unto the truth . Every one that is của the truth heareth my voice .
Phi-láte saith unto him , What is truth ? và when he had nói this , he went out again unto the Dân Do-thái , và saith unto them , I find in him no fault at all .
But ye have a custom , that I should release unto you một at the passover : will ye therefore that I release unto you the King của the Dân Do-thái ?
Then cried they all again , saying , Not this man , but Barabbas . Now Barabbas was a robber .

CHAPTER 19.
Then Phi-láte therefore took Đức Giê-su , và scourged him .
và the soldiers platted a crown của thorns , và put it on his head , và they put on him a purple robe ,
và nói , Hail , King của the Dân Do-thái ! và they smote him with their hands .
Phi-láte therefore went forth again , và saith unto them , Kìa , I bring him forth to you , that ye may know that I find no fault in him .
Then came Đức Giê-su forth , wearing the crown của thorns , và the purple robe . và Phi-láte saith unto them , Kìa the man !
When the chief priests therefore và officers thấy him , they cried out , saying , Crucify him , crucify him . Phi-láte saith unto them , Take ye him , và crucify him : for I find no fault in him .
The Dân Do-thái answered him , We have a law , và by our law he ought to die , because he made himself con trai của Đức Chúa Trời .
When Phi-láte therefore heard that saying , he was the more afraid ;
và went again into the judgment hall , và saith unto Đức Giê-su , Whence art thou ? But Đức Giê-su gave him no answer .
Then saith Phi-láte unto him , Speakest thou not unto me ? knowest thou not that I have power to crucify thee , và have power to release thee ?
Đức Giê-su answered ,
Thou couldest have no power at all against me , except
it were given thee from above : therefore he that delivered me unto thee hath the greater sin .
và from thenceforth Phi-láte sought to release him : but the Dân Do-thái cried out , saying , nếu thou let this man go , thou art not Cæsar's friend : whosoever maketh himself a king speaketh against Cæsar .
When Phi-láte therefore heard that saying , he brought Đức Giê-su forth , và sat down in the judgment seat in a place that is called the Pavement , but trong the Hebrew , Gabbatha .
và it was the preparation của the passover , và about the sixth hour : và he saith unto the Dân Do-thái , Kìa your King !
But they cried out , Away with him , away with him , crucify him . Phi-láte saith unto them , Shall I crucify your King ? The chief priests answered , We have no king but
Cæsar .
Then delivered he him therefore unto them to be crucified . và they took Đức Giê-su , và led him away .
và he bearing his cross went forth into a place gọi the place của a skull , which is called trong the Hebrew Golgotha :
Where they crucified him , và hai other with him , on either
side one , và Đức Giê-su trong the midst .
UNSURE: Since "enteuthen kai enteuthen" is an idomatic phrase, how to place it.
và Phi-láte
wrote a title , và put it on the cross . và the writing was ,
Đức Giê-su của NAZARETH THE KING của THE Dân Do-thái
.
This title then read many của the Dân Do-thái : for the place where Đức Giê-su was crucified was nigh to the city : và it was written trong Hebrew , và Greek , và Latin .
Then nói the chief priests của the Dân Do-thái to Phi-láte , Write not , The King của the Dân Do-thái ; but that he nói , I am King của the Dân Do-thái .
Phi-láte answered , What I have written I have written .
Then the soldiers , when they had crucified Đức Giê-su , took his garments , và made bốn parts , to every soldier a part ; và also his coat : now the coat was without seam , woven from the top
throughout .
They nói therefore among themselves , Let us not rend it , but cast lots for it , whose it shall be : that the scripture might be fulfilled , which saith , They parted my raiment among them , và for my vesture they did cast lots . These things therefore
the soldiers did .
Now there stood by the cross của Đức Giê-su his mother , và his mother's sister , Mary the wife của Cleophas , và Mary Magdalene .
When Đức Giê-su therefore thấy his mother , và the disciple standing by , whom he đã yêu , he saith unto his mother ,
Woman , Kìa thy son !
Then saith he to the disciple ,
Kìa thy mother !
và from that hour that disciple took her unto his own home.
After this , Đức Giê-su knowing that all things were now accomplished , that the scripture might be fulfilled , saith ,
I thirst .
Now there was set a vessel full của vinegar : và they filled a spunge with vinegar , và put it upon hyssop , và put it to his mouth .
When Đức Giê-su therefore had received the vinegar , he nói ,
It is finished :
và he bowed his head , và gave up the ghost .
The Dân Do-thái therefore , because it was the preparation , that the bodies should not remain upon the cross on the sabbath day , ( for that sabbath day was an high ngày ,) besought Phi-láte that their legs might be broken , và that they might be taken away .
Then came the soldiers , và brake the legs
của the first , và của the other which was crucified with him .
But when they came to Đức Giê-su , và saw that he was dead already , they brake not his legs :
But một của the soldiers with a spear pierced his side , và forthwith came there out blood và nước .
và he that saw it bare record , và his record is true : và he knoweth that he saith true , that ye might believe .
For these things were done , that the scripture should be fulfilled , A bone của him shall not be broken .
và again another scripture saith , They shall look on him whom they pierced .
và after this Giô-sép của Arimathaea , being a disciple của Đức Giê-su , but secretly for fear của the Dân Do-thái , besought Phi-láte that he might take away the body của Đức Giê-su : và Phi-láte gave him leave . He came therefore , và took the body của Đức Giê-su .
và there came also Nicodemus , which at the first came to Đức Giê-su by night , và brought a mixture của myrrh và aloes , about an hundred pound weight .
Then took they the body của Đức Giê-su , và wound it trong linen clothes with the spices , as the manner của the Dân Do-thái is to bury .
Now in the place where he was crucified there was a garden ; và in the garden a new sepulchre , wherein was never man yet laid .
There laid they Đức Giê-su therefore because của the Dân Do-thái' preparation ngày ; for the sepulchre was nigh at hand .

CHAPTER 20.
The first ngày của the week cometh Mary Magdalene early , when it was yet dark , unto the sepulchre , và seeth the stone taken away from the sepulchre .
Then she runneth , và cometh to Simon Phi-e-rơ , và to the other disciple , whom Đức Giê-su đã yêu , và saith unto them , They have taken away Đức Chúa Trời out of the sepulchre , và we know not where they have laid him .
Phi-e-rơ therefore went forth , và that other disciple , và came to the sepulchre .
So they ran both together : và the other disciple did outchạy
Phi-e-rơ , và came first to the sepulchre .
và he stooping down , và looking in , thấy the linen clothes lying ; yet went he not in .
Then cometh Simon Phi-e-rơ following him , và went into the sepulchre , và seeth the linen clothes lie ,
và the napkin , that was about his head , not lying with the linen clothes , but wrapped together in
a place by itself .
Then went in also
that other disciple , which came first to the sepulchre , và he saw , và believed .
For as yet they knew not the scripture , that he must rise again from the dead .
Then các môn đệ went away again unto their own home .
But Mary stood without at the sepulchre weeping : và as she wept , she stooped down , và looked into the sepulchre ,
và seeth hai các thiên sứ in white sitting , the one at the head , và the other at the feet , where the body của Đức Giê-su had lain .
và they say unto her , Woman , why weepest thou ? She saith unto them , Because they have taken away my Lord , và I know not where they have laid him .
và when she had thus nói , she turned herself
back , và thấy Đức Giê-su standing , và knew not that it was Đức Giê-su .
Đức Giê-su saith unto her ,
Woman , why weepest thou ? whom seekest thou ?
She , supposing
him to be the gardener , saith unto him , Sir , nếu thou have borne him hence , tell me where thou hast laid him , và I will take him away .
Đức Giê-su saith unto her ,
Mary .
She turned herself ,
và saith unto him , Rabboni ; which is to say , Master .
Đức Giê-su saith unto her ,
Touch me not ; for I am not yet ascended to my Father : but go to my brethren , và say unto them , I ascend unto my Father , và your Father ; và to my Chúa , và your Chúa .
Mary Magdalene came và told các môn đệ that she had seen Đức Chúa Trời , và that he had spoken these things unto her .
Then the same ngày at evening , being the first ngày của the week , when the doors were shut where các môn đệ were assembled for fear của the Dân Do-thái , came Đức Giê-su và stood in the midst , và saith unto them ,
Peace be unto you .
và when he had so nói , he shewed unto them his hands và his side . Then were các môn đệ glad , when they saw Đức Chúa Trời .
Then nói Đức Giê-su to them again ,
Peace be unto you : as my Father hath sent me , even so send I you .
và when he had nói this , he breathed on them , và saith unto them ,
Receive ye the Holy Ghost :
Whose soever sins ye remit , they are remitted unto them ; và whose soever sins ye retain , they are retained .
But Thomas , một của mười hai (môn đệ) , gọi Didymus , was not with them when Đức Giê-su came .
The other các môn đệ therefore nói unto him , We have seen Đức Chúa Trời . But he nói unto them , Except
I shall see in his hands the print của the nails , và put my finger into the print của the nails , và thrust my hand into his side , I will not
believe .
và after tám days again his các môn đệ were within , và Thomas with them : then came Đức Giê-su , the doors being shut , và stood in the midst , và nói ,
Peace be unto you .
Then saith he to Thomas ,
Reach hither thy finger , và Kìa my hands ; và reach hither thy hand , và thrust it into my side : và be not faithless , but believing .
và Thomas answered và nói unto him , My Lord và my Chúa .
Đức Giê-su saith unto him ,
Thomas , because thou hast seen me , thou hast believed : blessed are they that have not seen , và yet have believed .
và many other signs
truly did Đức Giê-su trong the presence of his các môn đệ , which are not written in this book :
But these are written , that ye might believe that Đức Giê-su is the Christ , con trai của Đức Chúa Trời ; và that believing ye might have life through his name .

CHAPTER 21.
After these things Đức Giê-su shewed himself again to các môn đệ at the sea của Tiberias ; và on this wise shewed he himself .
There were together Simon Phi-e-rơ , và Thomas gọi Didymus , và Nathanael của Cana trong Galilee , và the các con trai của Zebedee , và hai other của his các môn đệ .
Simon Phi-e-rơ saith unto them , I go a fishing . They say unto him , We also go with thee . They went forth , và entered into a ship immediately ; và
that đêm they caught nothing .
But when the morning was now come , Đức Giê-su stood on the shore : but các môn đệ knew not that it was Đức Giê-su .
Then Đức Giê-su saith unto them ,
Children , have ye
any meat ?
They answered him , No .
và he nói unto them ,
Cast the net on the right side của the ship , và ye shall find .
They cast therefore , và now they were not able to draw it for the multitude của fishes .
Therefore that disciple whom Đức Giê-su đã yêu saith unto Peter , It is Đức Chúa Trời . Now when Simon Phi-e-rơ heard that it was Đức Chúa Trời , he girt his fisher's coat unto him , ( for he was trần truồng ,) và did cast himself into the sea .
và the other các môn đệ came in a little ship ; ( for they were not far from đất , but as it were
two hundred cubits ,) dragging the net with fishes .
As soon then as they were come to đất , they saw a fire of coals there , và fish laid thereon , và bread .
Đức Giê-su saith unto them ,
Bring của the fish which ye have now caught .
Simon Phi-e-rơ went up , và drew the net to đất full của great fishes , an hundred và năm mươi và ba (3) : và for all there were so many , yet was not the net broken . NOTE! Extra word: "treis"
Đức Giê-su saith unto them ,
Come và dine .
và none của các môn đệ durst ask him , Who art thou ? knowing that it was Đức Chúa Trời .
Đức Giê-su then cometh , và taketh bread , và giveth them , và fish likewise .
This is now the third time that Đức Giê-su shewed himself to his các môn đệ , after that he was risen from the dead .
UNSURE: I was going to split "matheitais" here to go with the prepositional inference presented by the defintate article in the dative case. However, I have so far used the genitive of possession và so here for the sake of consistency alone do it again.
So when they had dined , Đức Giê-su saith to Simon Phi-e-rơ ,
Simon , son của Jonas , lovest thou me more than these ?
He saith unto him , Yea , Lord ; thou knowest that I love thee . He saith unto him ,
Feed my lambs .
NOTE: Extra word: "touton"
He saith to him again the second time ,
Simon , son của Jonas , lovest thou me ?
He saith unto him , Yea , Lord ; thou knowest that I love thee . He saith unto him ,
Feed my chiên .
He saith unto him the third time ,
Simon , son của Jonas , lovest thou me ?
Phi-e-rơ was grieved because he nói unto him the third time , Lovest thou me ? và he nói unto him , Lord , thou knowest all things ; thou knowest that I love thee . Đức Giê-su saith unto him ,
Feed my chiên .
Quả thật , quả thật , Ta nói với ngươi , Khi người còn trẻ , thou girdedst thyself , và walkedst whither thou wouldest : but khi ngươi già , thou shalt stretch forth thy hands , và another shall gird thee , và carry thee whither thou wouldest not .
This spake he , signifying by what death he should glorify Chúa . và when he had spoken this , he saith unto him ,
Follow me .
Then Phi-e-rơ , turning about , seeth the disciple whom Đức Giê-su đã yêu following ; which also leaned on his breast at supper , và nói , Lord , which is he that betrayeth thee ?
Phi-e-rơ seeing him saith to Đức Giê-su , Lord , và what shall this man do ?
Đức Giê-su saith unto him ,
nếu I will that he tarry till I come , what is that to thee ? follow thou me .
Then went this saying abroad among the brethren , that that disciple should not die : yet Đức Giê-su nói
not unto him , He shall not die ; but , nếu I will that he tarry till I come , what is that to thee ?
This is the disciple which testifieth của these things , và wrote these things : và we know that his testimony is true .
và there are also many other things which Đức Giê-su did , the which , nếu they should be written every một , I suppose that even the world itself could not contain the books that should be written . Amen .

div.title: THE EPISTLE OF Phao-lô THE sứ đồ TO TITUS
div.chapter:
CHAPTER 2.
But speak thou the things which become sound doctrine :
That the aged men be sober , grave , temperate , sound trong faith , trong charity , trong patience .
The aged women likewise , that they be in behaviour as becometh holiness , not false accusers , not given to much wine , teachers of good things ;
That they may teach the young women to be sober , to love their husbands , to love their children ,
EINAI was left untagged; there's jsut no way to fit it into the VNI translation
To be discreet , chaste , keepers at home , good , obedient to their own husbands , that the word của Đức Chúa Trời be not blasphemed .
Young men likewise exhort to be sober minded .
In all things shewing thyself a pattern của good works : in doctrine shewing uncorruptness , gravity , sincerity ,
Sound speech , that cannot be condemned ; that he that is của the contrary part may be ashamed , having no evil thing to say của you .
Exhort những đầy tớ to be obedient unto their own masters , và to please them well in all things ; not answering again ;
Not purloining , but shewing all good fidelity ; that they may adorn the doctrine của Đức Chúa Trời our Saviour in all things .
For the grace của Đức Chúa Trời that bringeth salvation hath appeared to all men ,
I tagged hH as "that bringeth" (certainly a stretch), but the alternative would be to leave "bringeth" standing unconnected to any Greek word -- not necessarily a bad thing.
Teaching us that , denying ungodliness và worldly lusts , we should live soberly , righteously , và godly , in this present world ;
Looking for that blessed hope , và the glorious appearing của the great Chúa và our Saviour Đức Giê-su Christ ;
Who gave himself for us , that he might redeem us from all iniquity , và purify unto himself a peculiar people , zealous của good works .
These things speak , và exhort , và rebuke with all authority . Let no man despise thee .

CHAPTER 3.
Put them trong mind to be subject to principalities và powers , to obey magistrates , to be ready to every good work ,
To speak evil of no man , to be no brawlers , but gentle , shewing all meekness unto all men .
For we ourselves also were sometimes foolish , disobedient , deceived , serving divers lusts và pleasures , living in malice và envy , hateful , và hating one another .
But after that the kindness và love của Đức Chúa Trời our Saviour toward man appeared ,
Not by works của sự công chính which we have done , but according to his mercy he saved us , by the washing của regeneration , và renewing của the Holy Ghost ;
Which he shed on us abundantly through Đức Giê-su Christ our Saviour ;
That being justified by his grace , we should be made heirs according to the hope của eternal life .
This is a faithful saying , và these things I will that thou affirm constantly , that they which have believed trong Đức Chúa Trời might be careful to maintain good works . These things are good và profitable unto men .
But avoid foolish questions , và gia-phổ , và contentions , và strivings about the law ; for they are unprofitable và vain .
A man that is an heretick after the first và second admonition reject ;
Knowing that he that is such is subverted , và sinneth , being condemned of himself .
When I shall send Artemas unto thee , or Tychicus , be diligent to come unto me to Nicopolis : for I have determined there to winter .
Bring Zenas the lawyer và Apollos on their journey diligently , that nothing be wanting unto them .
và let ours also learn to maintain good works for necessary uses , that they be not unfruitful .
All that are with me salute thee . Greet them that love us in đức tin . Grace be with you all . Amen .
div.div: It was written to Titus, ordained the first bishop of the church of the Cretians, from Nicopolis of Macedonia.

div.title: THƯ CỦA SỨ ĐỒ PHAO-LÔ GỬI CHO PHI-LÊ-MÔN
div.chapter: Phao-lô , một tù nhân của Đức Giê-su Christ , và Ti-mô-thê anh em chúng ta , gửi đến Phi-lê-môn yêu dấu và bạn đồng lao của chúng tôi , và đến chị A-phi yêu dấu , và anh A-chíp chiến hữu của chúng tôi , và hội thánh trong nhà anh : Nguyền xin ân điển và sự bình an đến với anh chị em , từ Đức Chúa Trời Cha chúng ta và Đức Chúa Giê-su Christ . Tôi tạ ơn Đức Chúa Trời của tôi , luôn nhắc đến anh khi trong sự cầu nguyện của tôi , Nghe về tình thương và đức tin của anh , mà anh dành cho Đức Chúa Giê-su , và đến cả các thánh đồ ; Thể nào sự thông công đức tin của anh trở nên hiệu quả bởi sự nhận thấy của mọi điều tốt đẹp trong chúng ta trong Đức Giê-su Christ . Vì chúng tôi có một vui mừng lớn và sự cảm kích trong tình thương của anh , bởi vì lòng của các thánh đồ được phấn khởi bởi anh , hỡi anh .
